title: Multivariate
text: kNN calculates distances data point k-nearest neighbors, snd assigns outlier score based distance. outlier score 0.95, kNN considers data point outlier.

title: Multivariate
text: Local Outlier Factor point average density around k-nearest neighbors point divided density around point . LoF score 1, ts likely anomalous, 1, less likely anomalous.

title: Multivariate
text: information mahalanobis method

title: Multivariate
text: iForest stands isolation forest. First, randomly selects variable, randomly selects value variable. work quantitaive categorical; variable quantitative, randomly pick number range variable, variable categorical randomly pick level. split data using value randomly selected eariler. iForest method repeats steps points separatly node. , data point, counts many splits needed isolate . selection variables values random, process return different results time. Therefore, isolation trees repeated many times results averaged trials. isolated points lower average path lengths. isolated rest data’s distribution, therefore called outliers.

title: Univariate
text: boxplot method univariate outlier detection identifies extreme data points examining distribution values using boxplot. method, “whiskers” boxplot represent range typical values within dataset. function, outliers defined values fall outside whiskers, calculated Q1−1.58×IQR lower bound Q3+1.58×IQR upper bound, Q1 Q3 first third quartiles, respectively, IQR interquartile range (difference Q3 Q1) allow broader range different threshold detecting extreme values. 1.58 length whiskers multiple IQR. method helps quickly identify potential outliers, plotted individually can indicate unusual problematic data points may warrant investigation. output provide identified outliers along corresponding row numbers, graphical representation generated outliers highlighted red.
code: data(mtcars) univOutliers(mtcars, "mpg", method="boxplot") #> No outliers detected for mpg univOutliers(mtcars, "hp", method="boxplot") #> Outliers detected for hp : #> Row 31 : 335 univOutliers(mtcars, "qsec", method="boxplot") #> Outliers detected for qsec : #> Row 9 : 22.9

title: Univariate
text: information grubb’s test

title: Univariate
text: MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) method univariate outlier detection identifies outliers based robust measure variability, median absolute deviation. method, red line represents median values target vector. upper CI limit median + 3MAD lower CI limit median - 3MAD. points outside confidence interval outliers detected MAD method. output provides list identified outliers along row numbers graphical representation outliers highlighted red.

what: Identification of Multivariate and Univariate Outliers
title: Identification of Multivariate and Univariate Outliers
text: goal qacOutliers help detect multivariate univariate outliers using seven different methods. package consolidates methods multiple different R packages makes easily accessible.

title: Identification of Multivariate and Univariate Outliers
text: can install development version qacOutliers GitHub :

title: Identification of Multivariate and Univariate Outliers
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(qacOutliers) #> Warning: replacing previous import 'dplyr::lag' by 'stats::lag' when loading #> 'qacOutliers' #> Warning: replacing previous import 'dplyr::filter' by 'stats::filter' when #> loading 'qacOutliers' #> Warning: replacing previous import 'dbscan::as.dendrogram' by #> 'stats::as.dendrogram' when loading 'qacOutliers' ## basic example code

title: Multivariate Outlier Detection — multiOutliers
text: Identifies multivariate outliers using four different methods.

title: Multivariate Outlier Detection — multiOutliers
code: multiOutliers(   data,   varlist = names(data),   method,   minPts = 10,   k = 5,   threshold = 0.95,   alpha = 0.1,   na.rm = TRUE,   ... )

title: Multivariate Outlier Detection — multiOutliers
text: data data frame varlist list numeric variables method character, supplies method used outlier detection. Methods LoF, kNN, mahalanobis, iForest minPts (optional) numeric, minimum points used LoF outlier detection. Default value 5 k (optional) k value used kNN method outlier detection. Default value 5 threshold (optional) threshold used kNN outlier detection. Default value 0.95 alpha (optional) alpha used mahalanobis distance outlier detection. Default value 0.1

title: Multivariate Outlier Detection — multiOutliers
text: indices detected outliers,

title: Multivariate Outlier Detection — multiOutliers
code: data(mtcars) multiOutliers(mtcars, method="mahalanobis") #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union #> Loading required package: cli #>  #> Method: mahalanobis #> Dataset: mtcars #> Variables: mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb #> Row: 9 27 29 31 #> Outlier Score: 22.59312 18.35616 21.573 19.19238 #> Message:  #> Option 1 : Message = multiOutliers(mtcars, method="LoF") #>  #> Method: LoF #> Dataset: mtcars #> Variables: mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb #> Row: 31 #> Outlier Score: 1.644219 #> Message:  Outliers detected #> Option 1 : minPts = 10 multiOutliers(mtcars, method="kNN") #> Loading required package: FNN #>  #> Method: kNN #> Dataset: mtcars #> Variables: mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb #> Row: 31 #> Outlier Score: 122.3174 #> Message:  Outliers detected #> Option 1 : k = 5 multiOutliers(mtcars, method="iForest") #> Due to small sample size, reduced 'min.node.size' to 11 #>  #> Method: iForest #> Dataset: mtcars #> Variables: mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb #> Row: 31 9 31 #> Outlier Score: 3.868148 3.55932 3.472923 #> Message:  Outliers detected #> Error in x[[i]]: subscript out of bounds

title: Printing Univariate Outlier Detection — print.univOutliers
text: Prints identified univariate outliers using boxplot, Grubbs test, MAD method

title: Printing Univariate Outlier Detection — print.univOutliers
text: x results univariate outlier detection function (e.g., boxplot, grubbsTest, MAD)

title: Printing Univariate Outlier Detection — print.univOutliers
text: formatted print results univariate outlier detection

title: Printing Univariate Outlier Detection — print.univOutliers
code: data(mtcars) outliers_boxplot <- univOutliers(mtcars, "mpg", method="boxplot") #> No outliers detected for mpg   outliers_boxplot #> NULL outliers_mad <- univOutliers(mtcars$mpg, method="mad") outliers_mad #> NULL outliers_grubbs <- univOutliers(mtcars, "mpg", method="grubbs") #> Outliers detected for mpg : #> No outliers detected for mpg  outliers_grubbs #> NULL

title: Univariate Outlier Detection — univOutliers
text: Provides three methods detecting univariate outliers dataset.

title: Univariate Outlier Detection — univOutliers
text: data data frame containing variable analyzed. x character string naming numeric variable assess outliers. method character supplying method used outlier detection. Methods boxplot, mad, grubbs.

title: Univariate Outlier Detection — univOutliers
text: list containing ggplot object boxplot statistics.

title: Univariate Outlier Detection — univOutliers
code: # Generate example data set.seed(42) library(EnvStats) #> Error in library(EnvStats): there is no package called ‘EnvStats’ data1 <- data.frame(   var1 = rnorm(100, mean = 50, sd = 10),   var2 = c(rnorm(97, mean = 50, sd = 10), 150, 160, 170),   var3 = sample(1:100, 100, replace = TRUE, prob = (1:100)^2))   # Boxplot Method on test data univOutliers(data1, "var1", method = "boxplot") #> Outliers detected for var1 : #> Row 18 : 23.43545  #> Row 59 : 20.0691   univOutliers(data1, "var2", method = "boxplot") #> Outliers detected for var2 : #> Row 18 : 77.01891  #> Row 98 : 150  #> Row 99 : 160  #> Row 100 : 170   univOutliers(data1, method = "boxplot") #> Outliers detected for var1 : #> Row 18 : 23.43545  #> Row 59 : 20.0691   #> Outliers detected for var2 : #> Row 18 : 77.01891  #> Row 98 : 150  #> Row 99 : 160  #> Row 100 : 170   #> No outliers detected for var3    # MAD Method on test data univOutliers(data1, "var1", method = "mad") #> Outliers detected for var1 : #> Row 59 : 20.0691   univOutliers(data1, "var2", method = "mad") #> Outliers detected for var2 : #> Row 18 : 77.01891  #> Row 98 : 150  #> Row 99 : 160  #> Row 100 : 170   univOutliers(data1, method = "mad") #> Outliers detected for var1 : #> Row 59 : 20.0691   #> Outliers detected for var2 : #> Row 18 : 77.01891  #> Row 98 : 150  #> Row 99 : 160  #> Row 100 : 170   #> Outliers detected for var3 :   # Grubbs' Method on test data univOutliers(data1, "var1", method = "grubbs") #> Outliers detected for var1 : #> No outliers detected for var1  univOutliers(data1, "var2", method = "grubbs") #> Outliers detected for var2 : #> Row 98 : 150  #> Row 99 : 160  #> Row 100 : 170  univOutliers(data1, "var3", method = "grubbs") #> Outliers detected for var3 : #> No outliers detected for var3
